Message:
I needn’t a reason
nor right to be here?
Truly...?

“One’s worth lies in
the strength of their blade.”
...Those words linger
in my mind.

Though I was terrified
to voice my worries,
I couldn’t help but
ask the Duke...

“If a flower chooses
its place and season,
yet fails to bloom beautifully...
wouldn’t it only be cast away?

Is a flower...worthy of existing,
simply by being...?”

What followed was a silence
more terrifying than
any frigid gaze cast by
my father or brothers.

My body froze, stiff as stone.
Even my breath was bated
as I waited for his answer.

“If that is what
the flower desires,”
spoke the Duke.

That choice is not
for others to make—
’tis for the flower.

“...Yes. The flower shall
bloom amidst the snow
as much as it pleases...

Sunlight then breaks
through the clouds.
Winter’s end draws near.

And before I knew it,
the relentless echoes of
my father’s words had
fallen completely silent.
